text: Bad Ronald is a 1973 horror novel by Jack Vance first published by Ballantine Books."Title: Bad Ronald", The Internet Speculative Fiction Database \- Bad Ronald, Goodreads It was adapted into a made-for-television thriller, also called Bad Ronald, in 1974,David Hofstede (2004). What Were They Thinking? The 100 Dumbest Events in Television History. Back Stage Books. pp. 19–21. . as well as a French production, Méchant garçon, in 1992.Bad Ronald (1992) Méchant garçon (original title), IMDb \- Méchant garçon, British Film Institute Bad Ronald received a Prix Mystère de la critique in 1980 for best foreign novel.Prix Mystère de la Critique du Meilleur Roman étranger on Polars pourpre ==Plot summary== Ronald Wilby, a 17-year-old boy with divorced parents, lives with his mother. Living with his first sexual urges, he tries to rape a girl. He kills the girl and buries her. Having forgotten his jacket at the scene of the crime, he confesses to his mother, who decides to hide Ronald in their house. She tells the police that her son has disappeared. Ronald lives in his hidden room, only going out into the rest of the house at night. When his mother dies, a couple and their three daughters move into the house. ==Notes== Category:Novels by Jack Vance Category:1973 American novels
